abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column notes that Massachusetts guard Derrick Gordon and former NBA center Jason Collins, who both have come out as gay, are visiting Indianapolis for Final Four as controversy grows over state's religious freedom bill; observes that both sports and LGBT communities have joined in fight against divisive law, which allows businesses to refuse to offer certain services to gays and lesbians.
lead_paragraph: Derrick Gordon, a guard for the University of Massachusetts, was in Indianapolis to watch the Final Four, as was Jason Collins, the retired N.B.A. center who came out as a gay in 2013.

headline.main: Gay Athlete Encounters Divisive Indiana Law, and Support
headline.print_headline: A Gay Athlete Encounters a Divisive Indiana Law, and Support
